name: places/ChIJLSPVWYhYwokRLaFhpc9903w
adrFormatAddress: 2182 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA

editorialSummary.text: Drugstore chain selling a variety of beauty & health products, plus some grocery & household items.

originalText.text:
UPDATE: Alexis is still the best but recently this location hasn’t had a few of my medications in stock and they can only recommend going to another CVS location. They also rarely answer the phone so you have to go in person to find out that they can’t get your medications in.

Lots of negative reviews here so I wanted to chime in with a positive. Most of the people working the counter at the pharmacy are great. In particular, Alexis always greets everyone with a smile and keeps her cool no matter how rude a customer may be. She’s super helpful with everyone in our family and we love to see her when she’s working.

I have had issues with the pharmacy never picking up the phone and there is one male pharmacist in particular who is always pretty curt and rude regardless of how kind and curteous we are.

originalText.text: Cleanliness and lack of responsibility to check dog owners for proper paperwork. I wonder when the Health Department will shut them down. Within 10 minutes, 3 dogs were paraded through the store. 11/4/2019 another dog incident. 3/1/2020 another dog. 5/8/2021 with two more dogs 4/4/23 another dog 5/7/23 another dog 6/3 another dog 6/10 another dog 7/10 two dogs in one visit 8/2 two dogs in one visit 8/30 one dog in the 2 minutes I was there 10/15 another dog... And 2 more while waiting. 12/23 there were 3 dogs in 7 minutes

originalText.text: Truly awful pharmacist.  Came from ER to fill an RX phoned in by MD.  Pharmacist said they did not have it in stock.  Refused to check other CVS availability.  Very sick, I stumbled across Broadway to Apthorp, which has the medication in stock.  They said CVS had to transfer the RX.  So I stumbled back across Bway, coughing my lungs out, then the CVS pharmacist refused to transfer the RX.  Then he and a young male register worker started very loudly berating me, saying the RX (Sudafed) was a "CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE."  As if I were a drug addict.  In fact, I had a severe lung infection as a result of exposure to hazardous   pollution, and needed the Sudafed (per the ER MD) to breathe.  These two young men have no business working as medical professionals.  They are rude, disrespectful, and treat sick patients with astounding violations of privacy and lack of any medical ethics whatsoever.  Take your business elsewhere.

originalText.text: Terrible service and should be Zero stars!  I called to speak to the pharmacist on the provider line and never got anyone to answer the phone in 15 miutes of holding. I guess that I will have the patient select a new pharmacy.
